item.title: 8 Best Elden Ring Weapons For A Strength Faith Build, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring offers diverse and powerful weapon options to cater to any playstyle, from mages to traditional knights.
  • Combining build types can lead to versatile and powerful characters, especially with weapons that benefit from multiple stat modifiers.
  • Exciting and unique weapons like Envoy's Long Horn and Sword of Light/Darkness provide players with varied and dynamic combat options.

When it comes to build diversity and variety, Elden Ring has no shortage of powerful and fun options for players to choose from to suit any playstyle. Mages have a bountiful list of staffs and wands to choose from, and any traditional knight will be spoiled for choice with the long list of swords and other weapons available.

Combining build types can be incredibly useful, especially when specific weapons enjoy the benefit of multiple stat modifiers. A paladin-style build that focuses on healing with incantations and dishing out heavy strength-based damage can be incredibly versatile and powerful when taking on basic camps of enemies and destroying some of the hardest bosses in the game with little to no trouble.

8 Ordovis's Greatsword

Straight From The Crucible

  • Requirements : 25 Str, 13 Dex, 15 Faith
  • Skill : Ordovis's Vortex
  • Dropped by Crucible Knight Ordovis at Auriza Hero's Grave. Full guide.
  • Base Game

Ordovis's Greatsword is an absolute machine. The power comes from the incredible skill that charges up and then slams down in a burst of holy light, great for taking down groups of foes all at once. The scaling, with both faith and strength, allows the player to dish out some significant holy damage when starting into faith, while still dealing significant harm to those with resistances.

Players can pick up this mighty weapon after just a few bosses, allowing it to be carried through the mid-game, all the way to the core of the Erdtree. And when combined with some incantations, which any good faith user will be equipping anyway, the damage output can be insane while maintaining a high health pool with some good healing spells alongside it.

7 Erdtree Seal

A Paladin's Best Friend

  • Requirements : 40 Faith
  • No Skill
  • Found near the Omenkiller enemy below the Prison Town Church site of grace. Full Guide.
  • Base Game

While the strength component of a build is incredibly important, a good sacred seal pairing is just as important. The Erdtree Seal is the best option for a pure faith-based build and when combined with a powerful physical damage weapon, the buffs and damage output is nearly unmatched.

Found near Volcano Manor, it's worth taking the short detour to acquire it as it scales incredibly well with faith and provides some of the best possible healing outputs of any of the seals. Using it in conjunction with a suitable weapon that also scaled with faith like the Blasphemous Blade, also found in Volcano Manor, turns the player into a mighty fighter of holy proportions.

6 Ornamental Straight Sword

Two Is Better Than One

  • Requirements : 10 Str, 14 Dex
  • Skill : Golden Tempering
  • Dropped from the Grafted Scion at the Chapel of Anticipation, accessed by using the waygate at the Four Belfries.
  • Base Game

One of the first weapons the player will see in the whole game, the Ornamental Straight Sword is wielded by the very first enemy encountered. The cool part about this weapon is the built-in dual-wield function when two-handing it. Rather than needing to go find a second version or have a friend drop it, the player can experiment with the combos and damage output of the double sword moveset.

On top of this, the skill empowers the sword with holy power, turning the heavy attack into a crazy combo chain that shreds through anything unfortunate enough to get in its way. The holy damage and decent strength scaling make it a great choice for players starting into both faith and strength, and early access makes it a great choice to take on an entire playthrough.

5 Miquellan Knight's Sword

The Sword With No Master

  • Requirements : 11 Str, 11 Dex, 16 Faith
  • Skill : Sacred Blade
  • Found atop a bell tower in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree. Full Guide.
  • Base Game

Swinging a sword around is one thing when taking on opponents at close range, but sometimes it's nice to have a ranged option to snipe archers or oncoming enemies from afar. Thankfully, the Miquellan Knight's Sword is great at both, having a skill that fires a deadly blast at range, dealing significant holy damage to quell the evils of the world.

The triple scaling of strength, dexterity, and faith gives players the option to go full-on into the paladin fantasy or spread their skill points thinner for a more rounded build. If they choose the former however, the payoff is immense, as at high faith, the enemies can barely get close before being shot down by the devastating sacred blade that fires from the weapon.

4 Envoy's Long Horn

Gentle Notes With A Deadly Song

  • Requirements : 23 Str, 11 Dex, 18 Faith
  • Skill : Bubble Shower
  • Dropped by the large oracle envoy, in Leyndell, Royal Capital. Full Guide.
  • Base Game

One of the more peculiar weapons in Elden Ring , the Envoy's Long Horn is exactly what it says on the tin. A musical instrument turned bludgeoning great hammer that deals physical damage thanks to the strength scaling and a devastating moveset.

The best part is the player's ability to actually play the horn, blowing out a spray of golden bubbles that, though beautiful, are incredibly deadly if touched by any unsuspecting enemies. It is a great skill for taking down larger enemies that will soak up every last burst from the horn, particularly bosses such as Placidusax.

3 Golden Halberd

Shining Bright Right From The Start

  • Requirements : 30 Str, 14 Dex, 12 Faith
  • Skill : Golden Vow
  • Dropped from the Tree Sentinel in Limgrave. Full Guide.
  • Base Game

The Tree Sentinel serves as the first major roadblock for so many players. Some choose to stay around and tough it out right from the get-go, and others return later to enact their revenge. He is a powerful foe indeed early on and his weaponry is no push-over either. The Golden Halberd is a potent weapon that can be picked up early and provides a great buff for co-op or solo when taking on tougher battles.

One of the best use cases for the halberd is powerstancing with a second one. Holding two giant golden poles and sprinting forth with a sizable damage buff turns any fight into a cakewalk. The ability to jump, attack, and slam with consistent and devastating blows makes the strength and faith builds feel completely overpowered in just a few levels.

2 Sword Of Light/Darkness

Two Sides Of The Same Coin

  • Requirements : 14 Str, 11 Dex, 24 Faith
  • Skill : Light/Darkness
  • Requires the Stone-Sheathed Sword to be raised at specific locations. Full Guide.
  • DLC

Shadow of the Erdtree introduced many new and exciting weapons and builds to try, but none of them come close to the uniqueness and wow factor of the Sword of Darkness and Light. The player can choose to pick up either and swap back to the other form at any point, upon returning to specific parts of the map, using the initial Stone-Sheathed Sword to conjure forth the power of darkness and a beacon of light.

Both have the same scaling and requirements and give a great incentive to stat into faith to boost the immense power of their respective skills, summoning either a burst of light beams or a shroud of darkness to destroy enemies in a huge area. Each provides a slightly different approach and distinct use-case so it is down to the player to decide whether they are a warrior of light or a bringer of the dark.

1 Blasphemous Blade

Gruesome And Glorious

  • Requirements : 22 Str, 15 Dex, 21 Faith
  • Skill : Taker's Flames
  • Can be acquired from the Remembrance of the Blasphemous by trading with Enia. Full Guide.
  • Base Game

Tucked away in the depths of Volcano Manor lies Rykard, the slithering lord of Blasphemy, and after defeating him in cinematic fashion, the player can pick up this incredible weapon that hits like a truck and comes with a passive healing ability that allows players to keep the aggression going when taking on swarms of enemies.

It feels amazing to wield, swinging around a wriggling, fiery blade of destructive power that is perfect for players who want to focus on strength while having all the benefits of a faith build. To cap it all off, the skill Taker's Flames unleashes a giant line of fire ahead of the player that decimates anything in its path and maintains the healing capabilities of the blade itself. Healing and fire all wrapped into one make this the pinnacle of aggressive paladin combat.

item.title: 7 Bosses That Are Related In The Dark Souls Trilogy
item.description:
Summary

  • Gwyn, the ultimate challenge, expects you to extinguish his fading flame.
  • Gwynevere's size may amaze, but killing her dims Anor Londo's radiance.
  • Dark Sun Gwyndolin's boss fight gimmick is navigating an infinite corridor.

The Dark Souls trilogy has a lot to offer players, including formidable real and gimmick bosses, outstanding and interesting areas, and a ton of weapons and armor sets to use. Throughout the game, players will likely encounter some enemies that look like others, raising the question whether they have some kind of relationship.

Many of these enemies are secluded in optional areas that can be a lot of fun, whereas others, not so much, resulting in players missing the fight against them altogether. To shed a clearer light on the kinship of certain enemies, here are some of the bosses in the Dark Souls trilogy that are related .

7 Gwyn, Lord Of Cinder

The Patriarch Of A Powerful Dynasty

  • Father to Gwynevere, Gwyndolin, the Nameless King, and probably Filianore
  • When players face him, his flame is flickering

Gwyn, Lord of Cinder is the ultimate challenge players will have to overcome in their original Dark Souls playthrough. While many agree that the fight against him can be rather disappointing, especially because he can be parried quite easily, the encounter is still epic in many ways.

The soundtrack that plays while players try to defeat him is a staple in the Dark Souls franchise and can even make them feel emotional, as the last flame of life and might within him flickers. It is suspected that, along with Gwynevere, Gwyndolin, and the Nameless King, Gwyn is also the father of Filianore, as is suggested by The Small Envoy Banner.

6 Gwynevere, Princess Of Sunlight

The Most Beautiful Daughter Of The Lord Of Cinder

  • She is much larger than the average human
  • Killing her makes Anor Londo dark and lifeless

When players first encounter Gwynevere in Anor Londo during the events of the first Dark Souls game, they’ll probably be amazed by her size. Despite her not having any intimidating features, she can be quite impressive, even though she is friendly to players.

While there’s no reason to kill her, players will find that if they do so, Anor Londo will turn dark, and the apparent glory of its appearance quickly fades away. She is one of the daughters of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder. Arguably, the most beautiful one.

​​​

5 Dark Sun Gwyndolin

One Of The Most Skilled Children Of Gwyn

  • The son of Gwyn
  • Players must reach the end of an apparently infinite corridor during his boss fight

Dark Sun Gwindolin is yet another child of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, and players will encounter him as they explore the depths of Anor Londo. This boss can sometimes confuse players, as despite his feminine voice and appearance, Gywndolin is actually a male, which is something many players are surprised by when they finally discover it.

His boss fight is more a gimmick than an actual challenge, as players must reach the end of what appears to be an infinite corridor. Since he moves so quickly, using one of the best Dexterity rings in the game that also make an appearance in later installments can be a great idea.

4 Nameless King

The Chosen Heir To Gwyn's Throne

  • The firstborn son of Gwyn
  • Found in Archdragon Peak in Dark Souls 3

The Nameless King doesn't only have one of the most tragic stories in the entirety of the Dark Souls trilogy, but he's also one of the trickiest bosses in the franchise. Luckily, FromSoftware's developers decided to make him an optional boss, so defeating him is not mandatory to progress through the story.

He is the firstborn son of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, and was supposed to take the throne after his father's demise. Players can find him in Archdragon Peak, which can only be accessed by using the “Path of the Dragon” gesture.

3 Lothric, Younger Prince

The Younger Son Of A Lost Kingdom

  • Lothric seems frail and ill
  • He heavily relies on his brother's attacks

It's no secret that Lothric and Lorian are related, as they're even described as Elder and Younger Princes. They are the heirs to the Kingdom of Lothric, which has fallen to darkness, leaving them with nothing but tales of glories past and better days.

Lothric is not too powerful and relies on his brother Lorian to take on the Ashen One for most of the fight against the siblings. Players should look out for his spells as they dodge Lorian’s sword attacks, as they can also be quite devastating. That said, since the brothers don’t move as quickly, pairing a Strength build with some of the best rings in Dark Souls 3 to boost this attribute can be very effective.

2 Lorian, Elder Prince

A Skilled Warrior With No Mercy

  • Powerful sword strikes
  • He can teleport from one side of the arena to another

As opposed to Lothric, Lorian seems to be much larger, and while the reason behind this is unknown, he works very well with his brother during their boss fight. Lorian relies heavily on his massive sword to attack players and try to take them down. He can also teleport from one side of the boss arena to the other with the help of his brother’s magic.

By himself, he’s not a massive threat, but when Lothric hops on his back and starts attacking players as well, the true fight begins. If players are struggling with defeating them, they should look for every Undead Bone shard available in the game to make their Estus Flasks’ effect stronger.

1 Chaos Witch, Quelaag

A Powerful Humanoid Living In The Depths Of Blighttown

  • Interesting design that can be unsettling
  • Her lair is in Blighttown

Chaos Witch Quelaag is not only disturbing to look at, but she’s also located in Blighttown, one of the most widely-disliked areas in the entirety of the Dark Souls franchise. The boss fight against her isn’t too challenging if players bring along the right weapons for the job. However, this doesn’t mean that she will not require players to fight her more than once to emerge victorious.

She has a sister, referred to as “Quelaag’s Sister”, “The White Lady”, or “The Fair Lady”. She is a Firekeeper and is affiliated to the Chaos Servants.

item.title: Mullet MadJack: Best Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Mullet MadJack is an arcade FPS game where players must kill to stay alive.
  • The game features various unique weapons with distinct playstyles and upgrades that enhance their lethality.
  • Each weapon in the game, from the Handgun to the Railgun, offers different benefits and challenges for players to master.

Mullet MadJack takes the concept of overstimulation and turns it into a video game. Players assume control of the titular protagonist as he wades through robo-billionaires to save an internet star. Everything the player sees is streamed to a live audience that is hooked up to Jack's blood stream, injecting his body with dopamine every time he kills something. If he doesn't, his 10 seconds of life ticks down, killing him at zero.

Built around arcade FPS gameplay, Jack makes use of an arsenal of weapons in his pursuit of constant stimulation. Each comes with their own unique play style and line of upgrades that only make them even more deadly. For those looking for big dopamine hits, here are the best weapons in Mullet MadJack .

8 Handgun

Dumb But Useful

  • The Handgun is a secret weapon rewarded to players after they complete the game.
  • It is a parody of the Pistol.

HAMMER95 have taken a page of Dead Space 's book with the Handgun . The weapon, unlocked after beating the game, is quite literally just a hand gun. While likely only included as a neat spoof reward for players, the weapon does come with a kick. Dealing a bit more damage than the Pistol, the Handgun can be viably used to complete a Mullet MadJack player's run.

Its long-to mid-range capabilities make it quite versatile, too, but like other accuracy-based weapons in Mullet MadJack , lining up a shot can slow players down, losing them precious time.

7 SMG

High Fire Rate And High Recoil

  • Power: 3
  • Accuracy: 5
  • Speed: 10

The SMG's high fire rate makes it one of Mullet MadJack 's most satisfying weapons to use, allowing players to quickly spray and pray through rooms. Despite the speed at which a player can dispatch an enemy with it, the SMG does come with a couple of downsides.

Its high rate of fire means players will be reloading more often, something that is more crucial here than other shooters because of the time mechanics at play. It also comes with a lot of recoil. Players looking to use the SMG should make sure that they're grabbing upgrades that affect reload times whenever they show up at the end of a level.

6 Rifle

The All-Rounder

  • Power: 7
  • Accuracy: 6
  • Speed: 3

The Rifle acts as Mullet MadJack 's all-rounder weapon. The gun dishes out decent damage and controls relatively well. However, it is let down somewhat by a fire rate that feels slow when compared to other weapons like the SMG or the Plasma Gun.

The weapon's upgrades alleviate this somewhat by increasing its rate of fire with a mini-gun attachment and, at its third level, a grenade launcher that will shoot periodically while players blast through a level.

The Rifle is unlocked after 'unboxing' the game from the main menu.

5 Shotgun

Forget All About Aiming

  • Power: 10
  • Speed: 3
  • Range: 4

The Shotgun 's lever-action handling may take a little bit to get used to, as players have to wait for Jack to cock the weapon between each shot. In a game where every second counts, this weapon may seem a little redundant at first.

However, the Shotgun completely removes the need for a player to aim. As long as they're pointing in the general direction of an enemy, a player is likely to kill something. Once players get used to the lever-action shooting, they'll be able to wipe out floors with ease.

4 Pistol

Infinite Ammo

  • Power: 3
  • Accuracy: 10
  • Speed: 5

Being the game's starting weapon, the Pistol would have ranked lower among the best weapons in Mullet MadJack if it weren't for its level three upgrade. Without it, the gun functions how players would expect: dealing a fair amount of damage with fire rate dependent on the player's clicks.

The upgrade, however, adds an infinite bullet belt to the gun. This ridiculous addition removes the need to reload, allowing the player to be as trigger-happy as they like. There being no need to stop and reload means that players can also afford to be less accurate, saving them time by not having to properly line up shots.

3 Railgun

High Damage

  • Power: 10
  • Accuracy: 10
  • Speed: 3

On the surface, the Railgun seems like the antithesis of Mullet MadJack 's core gameplay experience. The gun fires a concentrated beam of energy that requires a cooldown between each shot, feeling slower than the lever action handling of the Shotgun.

Yet the Railgun makes up for this with its extremely high amount of damage, being capable of one-shotting most enemies in the game. Players looking to use the Railgun will have to spend some time getting used to its slower fire-rate, but it's worth it for the damage output.

2 Plasma Gun

Assault Rifle 2.0

  • Power: 3
  • Accuracy: 5
  • Speed: 10

The Plasma Gun is a juiced-up version of the Rifle, acting as a sort of combination of it and the SMG. The Plasma Gun sacrifices some of the accuracy of its counterpart in exchange for a higher rate of fire.

This change makes the Plasma Gun feel like the ultimate robo-shredder, dispatching enemies with ease at most distances. Similarly to the Pistol's third upgrade, players can unlock an infinite ammo version of the weapon, creating the potential for one to make it through a level with a simple click.

1 Katanas

Hack And Slash

  • Power: 7
  • Speed: 10
  • Range: 1

The Katana is definitely the most skill-based weapon in Mullet MadJack. It cripples the player's ranged capabilities, forcing them to cross rooms even faster to get up close and personal with enemies. Despite that, the weapon is still one of the most satisfying and rewarding to use in the game.

It comes in two variants: the Ice Katana that freezes enemies and the Fire Katana that allows players to make charged fire attacks. On top of these variations, the Katana acts like Thor's hammer, Mjolnir; it can be thrown at enemies before returning to the player. This ability can be upgraded to reduce the time in which it takes the Katana to fly back to the player, making up for its lack of range. With the Katana's attacks being capable of one-shotting - or one-slashing - enemies, it's worth putting in the time to get used to the weapon's unique play style.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Player Goes All Out to Avenge Horse
item.description:
Summary

  • A Red Dead Redemption 2 player exacted vengeance for their horse's death, unleashing a massive killing spree in Saint Denis.
  • Horses are important in RDR2 due to their vital role in travel, combat, and survival.
  • Revenge in RDR2 can have consequences like bounties.

A Red Dead Redemption 2 player has taken revenge to a whole new level after their horse was killed in the game. The smash-hit shooter, set in a semi-fictionalized United States during the final days of the Wild West, has taken the gaming world by storm since its 2018 debut. It went on to win multiple Game of the Year awards and shattered plenty of records, cementing its place as one of the best-selling video games of all time. Even years after its release, Red Dead Redemption 2 continues to draw strong player numbers, with gamers roaming the vast plains and sometimes seeking cold-blooded vengeance.

Rockstar Games boasts a revered catalog of titles, with Red Dead Redemption 2 sitting at the top alongside the legendary Grand Theft Auto series. Beyond these two iconic franchises, Rockstar has also delivered hits like Manhunt and Max Payne 3 . However, RDR2 stands out with its massive open world and hyper-realistic environments. The freedom to explore, hunt, and engage in shootouts is a major draw for fans, and in this case, that freedom was used to exact revenge for the death of Arthur's loyal four-legged companion.

A Redditor named Zdslayer1 recently shared a map of Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s main city, Saint Denis, covered in Xs – the aftermath of a massive killing spree. They explained it was an act of vengeance for their horse’s death. While many commenters were shocked by the scale of the retaliation, others questioned the image’s authenticity, claiming it had been posted before.

Red Dead Redemption 2 Player Exacts Massive Vengeance for the Killing of Their Horse

For many, the reaction was justified, given the vital role horses play in RDR2 . They are essential for travel, combat, and survival, making them a crucial part of the game. Red Dead Redemption 2 has various horse breeds, each featuring unique stats and strengths, with their performance greatly impacting gameplay. While the post doesn’t specify which type of horse was killed, it’s clear the player took the loss personally.

The act of revenge unfolds in one of the game's major cities, Saint Denis. While there are many settlements spread across its vast open world, Saint Denis is often considered Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s best town by many players. As a bustling center of industrialization, it offers plenty of entertainment and rich NPC interactions. It also serves as a key hub where players can stock up on supplies like weapons and meat.

Killing in RDR2 comes with consequences, and an act of vengeance on this scale undoubtedly led to a massive bounty. This would have triggered an onslaught of marshals and bounty hunters, eager for payback of their own. On the upside, looting bodies in Red Dead Redemption 2 is a great way to collect valuables like jewelry and money. However, given the sheer magnitude of the killing spree, it's unlikely the player managed to hold onto their loot for long.

item.title: Split Fiction: The Cake is Not a Lie Trophy/Achievement Guide
item.description:
Split Fiction is a co-op action-adventure game that blends elements of teamwork and exploration in a highly-exciting platform style. Controlling the duo of Zoe and Mio, Split Fiction players can take advantage of their abilities and powers to explore each stage, unlock hidden areas, and engage in intense battles with the many surrounding enemies and obstacles.

Achievements are always a bonus for players that strive for that extra challenge, but not all Split Fiction achievements are easy to tackle. Some provide extra difficulty, while others bring sheer joy to Split Fiction players. The Cake Is Not A Lie is one of those achievements that blends fun with challenge, and is a unique side quest to take on and complete.

It's Time To Blow Out The Candle

In Chapter 4-8: Final Dawn - Run and Gun, players will be tasked with guiding Zoe and Mio through a multi-level stage that involves portals, destructible objects, and a couple of enemies protected by forcefields. Having knowledge of when and where these enemies appear, and how to navigate the surrounding sections, is key to reaching the destination and unlocking this achievement.

For this achievement, there will be a secret wall to locate and go through. After getting past the purple portal section, jump into a portal to bring you to the right side. Next, jump onto the wall ahead and then once more to access the secret area on top of the boxes with the cake.

Focus On Color-Oriented Objects For Quick Movement

The road to this achievement begins with some simple, co-op play that focuses on Zoe and Mio targeting objects by their assigned color. Not only is it crucial to get this right, but doing so in a timely manner could be the difference between success and failure . The first set of obstacles involves acid-carrying spheres that will need to be taken down before the player can move on to the next stage.

In the two sections following this portion of the map, players will need to fire their weapons at color-specific cogs that spin backwards upon being hit. These objects will unwind if enough time passes, so making sure to hit them often and quickly before moving on is pivotal. Failure to do so puts Zoe and Mio in danger of the swinging bridge.

Return Fire On Pesky Machines

While the road to completing this achievement is pretty straightforward in terms of the direction players need to go, it doesn't mean it'll be easy. In fact, there are two sets of enemies during this achievement hunt that will test the player's patience and strategy. Luckily, there aren't many swarms to get through, and experienced players may be able to get through the artillery coming their way.

Unfortunately, players will need to be aware of the forcefields being used by the two rapid-fire weapons. Disarming the forcefield first is essential , as Zoe and Mio's weapons will not make any contact until then. Once the shield is down, players will need to time their shots right, as jumping and hovering around the ledge is necessary to hit the weapons. Stay at a distance to minimize the possibility of being hit.

Purple Portals Will Lead You In Many Directions

After getting past the many obstacles and field enemies, the hardest part of this adventure is over. Now, it's time to jump through some purple portals and follow the direction of each landing spot. Jumping into a portal will warp Zoe and Mio to the next portal, making movement to each level feel easy at first glance. The only thing to take into consideration is knowing which portal leads to a dead end.

The final portal spot will have Zoe and Mio jumping into the portal that will bring them back to the last one used. Once this is done, simply let Zoe and Mio jump back into the same portal. This is needed to get the necessary height to reach the platform, which happens to be the end of the road. Upon discovering the lit candle next to two portals, the player will unlock the The Cake Is Not A Lie achievement , bringing an end to the journey.
